data.title: Uitikon Climate, Weather By Month, Average Temperature (Switzerland)
data.meta_description: In Uitikon, the summers are comfortable and wet, the winters are very cold and snowy, and it is partly cloudy year round. Over the course of the year, the temperature typically varies from 27Â°F to 76Â°F and is rarely below 16Â°F or above 87Â°F.
data.text:
Climate and Average Weather Year Round in Uitikon Switzerland

In Uitikon, the summers are comfortable and wet, the winters are very cold and snowy, and it is partly cloudy year round. Over the course of the year, the temperature typically varies from 27Â°F to 76Â°F and is rarely below 16Â°F or above 87Â°F.

Based on the tourism score, the best time of year to visit Uitikon for warm-weather activities is from late June to early September.

Climate in Uitikon

very coldcoldcoolcomfortablewarmcoolcoldvery coldJanFebMarAprMayJunJulAugSepOctNovDecNowNow62%62%38%38%overcastclearprecipitation: 4.5 inprecipitation: 4.5 in2.2 in2.2 inmuggy: 1%muggy: 1%0%0%drydrytourism score: 6.6tourism score: 6.60.00.0

Average Temperature in Uitikon

The warm season lasts for 3.3 months, from May 31 to September 9, with an average daily high temperature above 68Â°F. The hottest month of the year in Uitikon is July, with an average high of 75Â°F and low of 56Â°F.

The cold season lasts for 3.6 months, from November 15 to March 2, with an average daily high temperature below 45Â°F. The coldest month of the year in Uitikon is January, with an average low of 27Â°F and high of 38Â°F.

Clouds

In Uitikon, the average percentage of the sky covered by clouds experiences significant seasonal variation over the course of the year.

The clearer part of the year in Uitikon begins around June 16 and lasts for 3.1 months, ending around September 19.

The clearest month of the year in Uitikon is July, during which on average the sky is clear, mostly clear, or partly cloudy 61% of the time.

The cloudier part of the year begins around September 19 and lasts for 8.9 months, ending around June 16.

The cloudiest month of the year in Uitikon is November, during which on average the sky is overcast or mostly cloudy 61% of the time.

Precipitation

A wet day is one with at least 0.04 inches of liquid or liquid-equivalent precipitation. The chance of wet days in Uitikon varies throughout the year.

The wetter season lasts 3.7 months, from May 1 to August 23, with a greater than 38% chance of a given day being a wet day. The month with the most wet days in Uitikon is June, with an average of 13.9 days with at least 0.04 inches of precipitation.

The drier season lasts 8.3 months, from August 23 to May 1. The month with the fewest wet days in Uitikon is February, with an average of 8.4 days with at least 0.04 inches of precipitation.

Among wet days, we distinguish between those that experience rain alone, snow alone, or a mixture of the two. The month with the most days of rain alone in Uitikon is June, with an average of 13.9 days. Based on this categorization, the most common form of precipitation throughout the year is rain alone, with a peak probability of 48% on June 10.

Daily Chance of Precipitation in Uitikon

Rainfall

To show variation within the months and not just the monthly totals, we show the rainfall accumulated over a sliding 31-day period centered around each day of the year. Uitikon experiences significant seasonal variation in monthly rainfall.

Rain falls throughout the year in Uitikon. The month with the most rain in Uitikon is June, with an average rainfall of 4.4 inches.

The month with the least rain in Uitikon is February, with an average rainfall of 2.0 inches.

Average Monthly Rainfall in Uitikon

Snowfall

As with rainfall, we consider the snowfall accumulated over a sliding 31-day period centered around each day of the year. Uitikon experiences some seasonal variation in monthly snowfall.

The snowy period of the year lasts for 4.4 months, from November 9 to March 20, with a sliding 31-day snowfall of at least 1.0 inches. The month with the most snow in Uitikon is December, with an average snowfall of 2.7 inches.

The snowless period of the year lasts for 7.6 months, from March 20 to November 9. The least snow falls around July 22, with an average total accumulation of 0.0 inches.

Average Monthly Snowfall in Uitikon

Sun

The length of the day in Uitikon varies significantly over the course of the year. In 2024, the shortest day is December 21, with 8 hours, 27 minutes of daylight; the longest day is June 20, with 15 hours, 57 minutes of daylight.

Hours of Daylight and Twilight in Uitikon

The earliest sunrise is at 5:28 AM on June 15, and the latest sunrise is 2 hours, 45 minutes later at 8:13 AM on December 31. The earliest sunset is at 4:35 PM on December 10, and the latest sunset is 4 hours, 52 minutes later at 9:27 PM on June 25.

Daylight saving time (DST) is observed in Uitikon during 2024, starting in the spring on March 31, lasting 6.9 months, and ending in the fall on October 27.

Moon

The figure below presents a compact representation of key lunar data for 2024. The horizontal axis is the day, the vertical axis is the hour of the day, and the colored areas indicate when the moon is above the horizon. The vertical gray bars (new Moons) and blue bars (full Moons) indicate key Moon phases.

Humidity

We base the humidity comfort level on the dew point, as it determines whether perspiration will evaporate from the skin, thereby cooling the body. Lower dew points feel drier and higher dew points feel more humid. Unlike temperature, which typically varies significantly between night and day, dew point tends to change more slowly, so while the temperature may drop at night, a muggy day is typically followed by a muggy night.

The perceived humidity level in Uitikon, as measured by the percentage of time in which the humidity comfort level is muggy, oppressive, or miserable, does not vary significantly over the course of the year, staying within 1% of 1% throughout.

Humidity Comfort Levels in Uitikon

Wind

This section discusses the wide-area hourly average wind vector (speed and direction) at 10 meters above the ground. The wind experienced at any given location is highly dependent on local topography and other factors, and instantaneous wind speed and direction vary more widely than hourly averages.

The average hourly wind speed in Uitikon experiences mild seasonal variation over the course of the year.

The windier part of the year lasts for 5.3 months, from November 24 to May 1, with average wind speeds of more than 6.0 miles per hour. The windiest month of the year in Uitikon is February, with an average hourly wind speed of 6.9 miles per hour.

The calmer time of year lasts for 6.8 months, from May 1 to November 24. The calmest month of the year in Uitikon is August, with an average hourly wind speed of 5.2 miles per hour.

Average Wind Speed in Uitikon

Best Time of Year to Visit

To characterize how pleasant the weather is in Uitikon throughout the year, we compute two travel scores.

The tourism score favors clear, rainless days with perceived temperatures between 65Â°F and 80Â°F. Based on this score, the best time of year to visit Uitikon for general outdoor tourist activities is from late June to early September, with a peak score in the first week of August.

Tourism Score in Uitikon

Tourism Score in Uitikonbest timeJanFebMarAprMayJunJulAugSepOctNovDec002244668810106.66.60.00.0NowNowtemperaturetemperaturecloudscloudsprecipitationprecipitationtourism score

The beach/pool score favors clear, rainless days with perceived temperatures between 75Â°F and 90Â°F. Based on this score, the best time of year to visit Uitikon for hot-weather activities is from early July to mid August, with a peak score in the last week of July.

Beach/Pool Score in Uitikon

Beach/Pool Score in UitikonJanFebMarAprMayJunJulAugSepOctNovDec002244668810104.24.20.00.0NowNowtemperaturetemperaturecloudscloudsprecipitationprecipitationbeach/pool score

Methodology

For each hour between 8:00 AM and 9:00 PM of each day in the analysis period (1980 to 2016), independent scores are computed for perceived temperature, cloud cover, and total precipitation. Those scores are combined into a single hourly composite score, which is then aggregated into days, averaged over all the years in the analysis period, and smoothed.

Our cloud cover score is 10 for fully clear skies, falling linearly to 9 for mostly clear skies, and to 1 for fully overcast skies.

Our precipitation score, which is based on the three-hour precipitation centered on the hour in question, is 10 for no precipitation, falling linearly to 9 for trace precipitation, and to 0 for 0.04 inches of precipitation or more.

Our tourism temperature score is 0 for perceived temperatures below 50Â°F, rising linearly to 9 for 65Â°F, to 10 for 75Â°F, falling linearly to 9 for 80Â°F, and to 1 for 90Â°F or hotter.

Our beach/pool temperature score is 0 for perceived temperatures below 65Â°F, rising linearly to 9 for 75Â°F, to 10 for 82Â°F, falling linearly to 9 for 90Â°F, and to 1 for 100Â°F or hotter.

Growing Season

Definitions of the growing season vary throughout the world, but for the purposes of this report, we define it as the longest continuous period of non-freezing temperatures (≥ 32Â°F) in the year (the calendar year in the Northern Hemisphere, or from July 1 until June 30 in the Southern Hemisphere).

The growing season in Uitikon typically lasts for 6.4 months (195 days), from around April 19 to around October 31, rarely starting before April 1 or after May 6, and rarely ending before October 12 or after November 22.

Time Spent in Various Temperature Bands and the Growing Season in Uitikon

frigid 15Â°F freezing 32Â°F very cold 45Â°F cold 55Â°F cool 65Â°F comfortable 75Â°F warm 85Â°F hot 95Â°F sweltering

Growing degree days are a measure of yearly heat accumulation used to predict plant and animal development, and defined as the integral of warmth above a base temperature, discarding any excess above a maximum temperature. In this report, we use a base of 50Â°F and a cap of 86Â°F.

Based on growing degree days alone, the first spring blooms in Uitikon should appear around April 22, only rarely appearing before April 8 or after May 6.

Solar Energy

This section discusses the total daily incident shortwave solar energy reaching the surface of the ground over a wide area, taking full account of seasonal variations in the length of the day, the elevation of the Sun above the horizon, and absorption by clouds and other atmospheric constituents. Shortwave radiation includes visible light and ultraviolet radiation.

The average daily incident shortwave solar energy experiences extreme seasonal variation over the course of the year.

The brighter period of the year lasts for 3.4 months, from May 7 to August 18, with an average daily incident shortwave energy per square meter above 5.5 kWh. The brightest month of the year in Uitikon is July, with an average of 6.4 kWh.

The darker period of the year lasts for 3.5 months, from October 27 to February 13, with an average daily incident shortwave energy per square meter below 2.2 kWh. The darkest month of the year in Uitikon is December, with an average of 1.2 kWh.

Average Daily Incident Shortwave Solar Energy in Uitikon

Topography

For the purposes of this report, the geographical coordinates of Uitikon are 47.369 deg latitude, 8.457 deg longitude, and 1,844 ft elevation.

The topography within 2 miles of Uitikon contains very significant variations in elevation, with a maximum elevation change of 1,424 feet and an average elevation above sea level of 1,716 feet. Within 10 miles also contains very significant variations in elevation (1,837 feet). Within 50 miles contains very significant variations in elevation (11,073 feet).

The area within 2 miles of Uitikon is covered by trees (41%), artificial surfaces (29%), and cropland (29%), within 10 miles by cropland (40%) and artificial surfaces (29%), and within 50 miles by trees (36%) and cropland (28%).

Data Sources

This report illustrates the typical weather in Uitikon, based on a statistical analysis of historical hourly weather reports and model reconstructions from January 1, 1980 to December 31, 2016.

Temperature and Dew Point

There are 4 weather stations near enough to contribute to our estimation of the temperature and dew point in Uitikon.

For each station, the records are corrected for the elevation difference between that station and Uitikon according to the International Standard Atmosphere , and by the relative change present in the MERRA-2 satellite-era reanalysis between the two locations.

The estimated value at Uitikon is computed as the weighted average of the individual contributions from each station, with weights proportional to the inverse of the distance between Uitikon and a given station.

The stations contributing to this reconstruction are:

Zurich Airport (LSZH, 41%, 8 mi, northeast, -430 ft elevation change)

DÃ¼bendorf Air Base (LSMD, 40%, 9 mi, east, -374 ft elevation change)

Emmen Air Base (LSME, 15%, 20 mi, south, -446 ft elevation change)

EuroAirport BaselâMulhouseâFreiburg (LFSB, 4.5%, 46 mi, west, -961 ft elevation change)

To get a sense of how much these sources agree with each other, you can view a comparison of Uitikon and the stations that contribute to our estimates of its temperature history and climate. Please note that each source's contribution is adjusted for elevation and the relative change present in the MERRA-2 data.

Other Data

All data relating to the Sun's position (e.g., sunrise and sunset) are computed using astronomical formulas from the book, Astronomical Algorithms 2nd Edition , by Jean Meeus.

All other weather data, including cloud cover, precipitation, wind speed and direction, and solar flux, come from NASA's MERRA-2 Modern-Era Retrospective Analysis . This reanalysis combines a variety of wide-area measurements in a state-of-the-art global meteorological model to reconstruct the hourly history of weather throughout the world on a 50-kilometer grid.

Land Use data comes from the Global Land Cover SHARE database , published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations.

Elevation data comes from the Shuttle Radar Topography Mission (SRTM) , published by NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory.

Names, locations, and time zones of places and some airports come from the GeoNames Geographical Database .

Time zones for airports and weather stations are provided by AskGeo.com .

Maps are © OpenStreetMap contributors.

Disclaimer

The information on this site is provided as is, without any assurances as to its accuracy or suitability for any purpose. Weather data is prone to errors, outages, and other defects. We assume no responsibility for any decisions made on the basis of the content presented on this site.

We draw particular cautious attention to our reliance on the MERRA-2 model-based reconstructions for a number of important data series. While having the tremendous advantages of temporal and spatial completeness, these reconstructions: (1) are based on computer models that may have model-based errors, (2) are coarsely sampled on a 50 km grid and are therefore unable to reconstruct the local variations of many microclimates, and (3) have particular difficulty with the weather in some coastal areas, especially small islands.

We further caution that our travel scores are only as good as the data that underpin them, that weather conditions at any given location and time are unpredictable and variable, and that the definition of the scores reflects a particular set of preferences that may not agree with those of any particular reader.
